title: 110_hr5600
content: The Act is titled the "District of Columbia Court, Offender Supervision, Parole, and Public Defender Employees Equity Act of 2008." It allows retirement credit for certain employees transferred from District of Columbia service to federal service. The "District of Columbia Court, Offender Supervision, Parole, and Public Defender Employees Equity Act of 2008" allows individuals who performed qualifying District of Columbia service to include that service in calculating their creditable service for specific provisions of title 5, United States Code related to annuity eligibility, retirement, survivor annuities, and disability benefits. Qualifying District of Columbia service is not considered when calculating benefits from the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Qualifying District of Columbia service is excluded from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Qualifying District of Columbia service refers to specific types of service performed by individuals in the District of Columbia government, excluding it from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. Service performed by individuals in the District of Columbia government, excluding it from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. This includes service as an employee of the District of Columbia Public Defender Service and Offender Supervision Trustee under the Balanced Budget Act of 1997. Service performed by individuals in the District of Columbia government, excluding it from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund. This includes service as an employee of the District of Columbia Department of Corrections under the priority consideration program established by the Bureau of Prisons. Service performed by individuals in the District of Columbia government, excluding it from benefit calculations in the Civil Service Retirement and Disability Fund, if performed before the individual's coverage as a Federal Government employee and without receiving credit under specific provisions of the United States Code. The Office of Personnel Management will accept certification from the District of Columbia government regarding an individual's qualifying service and its duration.
